narrative.title: Savona Division - 1941Q3
narrative.situation: Italian Auto-transportable Infantry Division (Frontier Defense) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q3.
narrative.objectives: FRONTIER DEFENSE DIVISION - Division assigned to static defense of Libya-Egypt frontier at Sollum-Bardia-Halfaya Pass sector (August-September 1941). Partially recovered from Operation Compass defeat. Preparing fortified positions for anticipated British offensive. Division on defensive footing with German DAK support attachments.
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
